intro: Cheirodendron platyphyllum subsp. kauaiense, commonly known as Kauai hibiscus, is a rare flowering plant native to the Hawaiian island of Kauai. It is characterized by its large, showy yellow flowers with red stamens and broad, heart-shaped leaves. The plant thrives in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests and is often found near streams or in rocky areas. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is notable for its unique floral structure and ecological significance. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and is protected under conservation efforts.
